description: The DevOps Lead is a single point of failure for all foundational infrastructure (IaC) and CI/CD setup, which is on the critical path in Sprint 1. Any unavailability will halt the project.
mitigation_strategy: Mandate pair programming sessions with the Backend Lead on critical Terraform modules. Ensure all IaC is thoroughly documented.
contingency_plan: Engage a pre-vetted on-demand DevOps contractor if the lead becomes unavailable for more than 2 days.
monitoring_trigger: Sprint 1 IaC tasks are more than 1 day behind schedule.

description: A zero-day vulnerability in `isolated-vm` could require immediate, expert-level security response that the team may not possess, halting the custom mode feature (RISK-003).
mitigation_strategy: Ensure Lambda has zero network access and minimal IAM permissions. Automate dependency scanning to provide early alerts.
contingency_plan: Disable the custom formula execution endpoint immediately via API Gateway. Have a pre-defined communication plan for users of the feature.
monitoring_trigger: Critical vulnerability alert from Snyk or Dependabot for `isolated-vm`.

description: The Backend Lead is the only resource capable of implementing complex, security-critical features and performing security reviews, creating a significant bottleneck.
mitigation_strategy: Offload standard CRUD endpoint development to a cross-trained developer or a new hire. Prioritize the Lead's time for architecture, security, and complex logic.
contingency_plan: Add a Mid-level Backend Developer to the team to handle less complex tasks and undergo mentoring from the lead.
monitoring_trigger: Backend tasks on the critical path showing >15% time variance.
